              .

              OF

text:
I
               
              am
               
              glad
               
              to
               
              see
               
              you
               
              in
               
              this
               
              merry
               
              vein
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
What
               
              means
               
              this
               
              jest
              ,
               
              I

              you
              ,

              ,
               
              tell
               
              me
              ?

ANTIPHOLUS

text:
Yea
              ,

              and

              me
               
              in
               
              the

              ?

text:
Think’st
               
              thou
               
              I
               
              jest
              ?

              ,

              that

              that
              .

              OF

text:
Hold
              ,

              ,
               
              for
               
              God’s
               
              sake
              !
               
              Now
               
              your
               
              jest
               
              is

              .

Upon

Because

Do

Your

And
               
              make

ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF

text:
If
               
              you

              jest
               
              with
               
              me
              ,
               
              know
               
              my
               
              aspect
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
And
               
              fashion
               
              your
               
              demeanor
               
              to
               
              my
               
              looks
              ,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Or
               
              I
               
              will
               
              beat
               
              this
               
              method
               
              in
               
              your
               
              sconce
              .

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: “Sconce” call you it? So you

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: would leave battering, I had rather have it a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: “head.” An you use these blows long, I must get a

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: sconce for my head and ensconce it too, or else I

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: shall seek my wit in my shoulders. But I pray, sir,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: why am I beaten?

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Dost thou not know?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Nothing, sir, but that I am

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: beaten.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Shall I tell you why?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Ay, sir, and wherefore, for they

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: say every why hath a wherefore.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: “Why” first: for flouting

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: me; and then “wherefore”: for urging it the second

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: time to me.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Was
               
              there
               
              ever
               
              any
               
              man
               
              thus
               
              beaten
               
              out
               
              of
               
              season
              ,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
When
               
              in
               
              the
               
              “
              why
              ”
               
              and
               
              the
               
              “
              wherefore
              ”
               
              is
               
              neither
               
              rhyme
               
              nor
               
              reason
              ?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text:
Well
              ,
               
              sir
              ,
               
              I
               
              thank
               
              you
              .

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Thank me, sir, for what?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, sir, for this something

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that you gave me for nothing.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I’ll make you amends next,

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: to give you nothing for something. But say, sir, is it

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: dinnertime?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: No, sir, I think the meat wants

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that I have.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: In good time, sir, what’s

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: that?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Basting.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Well, sir, then ’twill be dry.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: If it be, sir, I pray you eat none of

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: it.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Your reason?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Lest it make you choleric and

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: purchase me another dry basting.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Well, sir, learn to jest in

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: good time. There’s a time for all things.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I durst have denied that before

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: you were so choleric.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: By what rule, sir?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, sir, by a rule as plain as

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: the plain bald pate of Father Time himself.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Let’s hear it.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: There’s no time for a man to

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: recover his hair that grows bald by nature.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: May he not do it by fine and

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: recovery?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Yes, to pay a fine for a periwig,

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: and recover the lost hair of another man.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why is Time such a niggard

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: of hair, being, as it is, so plentiful an excrement?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Because it is a blessing that he

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: bestows on beasts, and what he hath scanted men

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: in hair, he hath given them in wit.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why, but there’s many a

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: man hath more hair than wit.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Not a man of those but he hath

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: the wit to lose his hair.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Why, thou didst conclude

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: hairy men plain dealers without wit.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: The plainer dealer, the sooner

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: lost. Yet he loseth it in a kind of jollity.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: For what reason?

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: For two, and sound ones too.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Nay, not sound, I pray you.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Sure ones, then.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Nay, not sure, in a thing

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: falsing.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Certain ones, then.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Name them.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: The one, to save the money that

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: he spends in tiring; the other, that at dinner they

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: should not drop in his porridge.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: You would all this time

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: have proved there is no time for all things.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Marry, and did, sir: namely, e’en

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: no time to recover hair lost by nature.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: But your reason was not

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: substantial why there is no time to recover.

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: Thus I mend it: Time himself is

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: bald and therefore, to the world’s end, will have

speaker:
DROMIO
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: bald followers.

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: I knew ’twould be a bald

speaker:
ANTIPHOLUS
               
              OF
               
              SYRACUSE
text: conclusion. But soft, who wafts us yonder?
